results.title: [The Working women's centre]
results.creator_credit: Laura Butterworth, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: As the Working Women’s Centre in South Australia faces budget cuts, Laura Butterworth reflects on the history of the centre, the stories of the women workers and the battles fought and won.

results.title: [The White continent]
results.brief_description: In late 1949, a joint expedition planned by the Governments of Britain, Norway and Sweden left for Queen Maude Land on the Antarctic continent - this was to be the first truly international expedition to the Antarctic. The film covers the first stage of the journey, from departure point in Europe to the establishment of the base camps and later withdrawal of the ship’s party, leaving the groups of scientists to their study of the unknown world of ice and snow. Photography by Tom Stobart.

Photography by Tom Stobart.

results.title: [The Vault]
results.creator_credit: Bill Nicholson Jr, Bronwen Gray and Alan Young
results.brief_description:
Fresh out of university, Bill Nicholson’s first professional job involved him identifying human remains located in the vault of the Melbourne Museum. Some of those remains were traced back to Truganina Explosives Reserve in Altona. This animation tells the story of how these remains, discovered in Melbourne’s west, were returned to their traditional resting place.
Please note : This animation is based on a story told by Aboriginal Bill Nicholson Jr, visually interpreted by a white artist.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Bill Nicholson Jr, Bronwen Gray and Alan Young
